newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia rubber ends mixed in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia rubber ends mixed in late trade.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 offer prices ended mixed in quiet trading on Thursday, with traders expecting a bearish trend on sluggish demand.
They said the market discounted the death of China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.
"The market generally ignores Deng Xiaoping's death," said one trader, adding that prices were mixed on expectation of further softening as buyers were scant.

Traders said SIR20 March price was slightly higher at 54.125 U.S. cents/lb fob Padang against morning's level of 54.00 U.S. cents/lb. But offer prices fell 0.50 U.S. cents to 54.00 fob Medan and Surabaya.
Traders said offer prices fell to 53.75 U.S. cents in Jambi against morning's price of 54.00, but levels were unchanged in Pontianak at 53.75. U.S. cents/lb.
Traders said U.S. buyers had came in, but orders were meagre at about 120 tonnes.
"There were a number of deals done but prices were low because there were not enough buyers out there," one said.
Traders said buyers seemed to be waiting for prices to decline further. "There is nothing much we can do. Prices can go as low as 53.00 U.S. cents/lb," another said.
Traders said they were still waiting for fresh enquiries from other foreign buyers.
